River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to this hybrid England/Australian production.

The wealthy sharecropper Gas (Edward Asner) has not enough to feed everybody at his plantation, so the food for some depends on finding it dish to dish by himself. When the Americans from space ship threaten mankind's entire food supply with a virus affected "cutter", things look very bad

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to create a cult phenomenon like the short-lived Bruce Lee martial arts films of the Sixties and Seventies.
